00025 #include "ext.h"                                // Required for all Max External Objects
00026 #include "ext_strings.h"                // Used for the assistance strings
00027 #include "z_dsp.h"                              // Required for all MSP externals
00028 
00029 void *teabox_class;                             // Required. Global pointing to this class
00030 
00031 
00032 // Data Structure for this object
00033 typedef struct _teabox{
00034         t_pxobject              x_obj;
00035         char                    counter;                // used for keeping track of the current sensor number
00036         float                   data[9];                // one container for the data from each sensor
00037         float                   hw_version;             // version number (major.minor) of the connected Teabox
00038         float                   last_value;             // used for error correction in the perform method
00039         void                    *outlet;                // outlet for status and version messages
00040 } t_teabox;
00041 
00042 
00043 // Prototypes for methods: need a method for each incoming message type:
00044 t_int *teabox_perform(t_int *w);                                                                        // An MSP Perform (signal) Method
00045 void teabox_dsp(t_teabox *x, t_signal **sp, short *count);                      // DSP Method
00046 void teabox_assist(t_teabox *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);      // Assistance Method
00047 void *teabox_new(void);                                                                                         // New Object Creation Method
00048 void teabox_getversion(t_teabox *x);
00049 void teabox_getstatus(t_teabox *x);
00050 
00051 
00052 /************************************************************************************/
00053 // Main() Function
00054 
00055 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00056 {
00057         setup((t_messlist **)&teabox_class, (method)teabox_new, (method)dsp_free, (short)sizeof(t_teabox), 0L, 0);
00058                                                 
00059         addmess((method)teabox_dsp,             "dsp", A_CANT, 0);              // Bind method "teabox_dsp" to the DSP call from MSP
00060         addmess((method)teabox_assist,          "assist", A_CANT, 0);   // Bind method "teabox_assist" to assistance calls
00061         addmess((method)teabox_getversion,      "getversion", 0);
00062         addmess((method)teabox_getstatus,       "getstatus", 0);
00063         
00064         dsp_initclass();                                                                                        // Setup object's class to work with MSP
00065         return 0;
00066 }
00067 
00068 
00069 /************************************************************************************/
00070 // Object Creation Method
00071 
00072 void *teabox_new(void)
00073 {
00074         short i;
00075         
00076         t_teabox *x = (t_teabox *)newobject(teabox_class);
00077         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x,1);
00078 
00079         x->outlet = outlet_new(x, 0L);                          // create the status/version outlet
00080         for(i=0; i<9; i++){
00081                 outlet_new((t_object *)x, "signal");    // Create new signal outlet
00082                 x->data[i] = 0;                                                 // Init this element of the data array
00083         }
00084                 
00085         x->counter = 0;                                                         // init member values
00086         x->hw_version = 0;
00087 
00088         return(x);                                                                      // return the pointer to our instance
00089 }
00090

00092 
00093 /************************************************************************************/
00094 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00095 
00096 // Method for Assistance Messages
00097 void teabox_assist(t_teabox *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00098 {
00099         if(msg == 1)            // Inlets
00100                 strcpy(dst, "(signal) Input");
00101         else if(msg == 2){      // Outlets
00102                 switch(arg){
00103                         case 0: strcpy(dst, "(signal) Demultiplexed Sensor Signal 1"); break;
00104                         case 1: strcpy(dst, "(signal) Demultiplexed Sensor Signal 2"); break;
00105                         case 2: strcpy(dst, "(signal) Demultiplexed Sensor Signal 3"); break;
00106                         case 3: strcpy(dst, "(signal) Demultiplexed Sensor Signal 4"); break;
00107                         case 4: strcpy(dst, "(signal) Demultiplexed Sensor Signal 5"); break;
00108                         case 5: strcpy(dst, "(signal) Demultiplexed Sensor Signal 6"); break;
00109                         case 6: strcpy(dst, "(signal) Demultiplexed Sensor Signal 7"); break;
00110                         case 7: strcpy(dst, "(signal) Demultiplexed Sensor Signal 8"); break;
00111                         case 8: strcpy(dst, "(signal) Digital Sensors, Encoded as INT"); break;
00112                         case 9: strcpy(dst, "(attributes) dumpout"); break;
00113                 }
00114         }
00115                 strcpy(dst, "(signal) Demultiplexed Output");
00116 }

00118 
00119 // Method for Posting Hardware Version
00120 void teabox_getversion(t_teabox *x)
00121 {
00122         short           version_major, version_minor;
00123         char            version_string[64];
00124         t_symbol        *version_symbol;
00125         t_atom          version_atom;
00126         
00127         version_major = (int)((x->hw_version * 4095.0) + 0.49) >> 8;
00128         version_minor = (int)((x->hw_version * 4095.0) + 0.49) & 255;
00129         
00130         //post("Teabox Firmware Version: %i.%i", version_major, version_minor);
00131         sprintf(version_string, "%i.%i", version_major, version_minor);
00132         version_symbol = gensym(version_string);
00133         SETSYM(&version_atom, version_symbol);
00134 
00135         outlet_anything(x->outlet, gensym("version"), 1, &version_atom);
00136 }
00137 
00138 
00139 // Method for Posting Status
00140 void teabox_getstatus(t_teabox *x)
00141 {
00142         t_atom  status_atom;
00143 
00144         if(x->hw_version){
00145                 SETLONG(&status_atom, 1);
00146         }
00147         else{
00148                 SETLONG(&status_atom, 0);
00149         }
00150         outlet_anything(x->outlet, gensym("status"), 1, &status_atom);
00151 }
00152 
00153 
00154 // Perform (signal) Method - delay is a constant (not a signal)
00155 t_int *teabox_perform(t_int *w)
00156 {
00157         t_teabox *x = (t_teabox *)(w[1]);               
00158         t_float *in = (t_float *)(w[2]);                // input
00159         t_float *out1 = (t_float *)(w[3]);              // sensor outputs [1-8]...
00160         t_float *out2 = (t_float *)(w[4]);
00161         t_float *out3 = (t_float *)(w[5]);
00162         t_float *out4 = (t_float *)(w[6]);
00163         t_float *out5 = (t_float *)(w[7]);
00164         t_float *out6 = (t_float *)(w[8]);
00165         t_float *out7 = (t_float *)(w[9]);
00166         t_float *out8 = (t_float *)(w[10]);
00167         t_float *out9 = (t_float *)(w[11]);             // toggle output [9]
00168         int n = (int)(w[12]);
00169         float   value;
00170         long    bitmask;
00171         
00172         if (x->x_obj.z_disabled) goto out;
00173         
00174         while(n--){
00175         
00176                 // INPUT SECTION
00177                 value = *in++;
00178 
00179                 if(value < 0.0 || x->counter > 9){                      // If the sample is the start flag...
00180                         if(x->last_value < 0.0)                                 // Actually - if all 16 toggles on the Teabox digital inputs
00181                                 x->data[8] = x->last_value;                     //      are high, it will look identical to the start flag - so
00182                                                                                                         //  so we compensate for that here.
00183                         x->counter = 0;
00184                 }
00185                 else if(x->counter == 0){                                       // if the sample is hardware version number...
00186                         x->hw_version = value * 8.0;                                                    
00187                         x->counter++;
00188                 }       
00189                 else{
00190                         x->data[x->counter - 1] = value * 8.0;  // Normalize the range
00191                         x->counter++;
00192                 }
00193                 
00194                 // POST-PROCESS TOGGLE INPUT BITMASK
00195                 if(x->data[8] < 0){
00196                         bitmask = x->data[8] * 32768;                   // 4096 = 32768 / 8 (we already multiplied by 8)
00197                         bitmask ^= -32768;
00198                         bitmask = 32768 + (bitmask);                    // 2^3
00199                 }
00200                 else
00201                         bitmask = x->data[8] * 4096;                    // 4096 = 32768 / 8 (we already multiplied by 8)
00202                 
00203 
00204                 // OUTPUT SECTION - PIPE THE STORED DATA OUT THE OUTLETS
00205                 *out1++ = x->data[0];
00206                 *out2++ = x->data[1];
00207                 *out3++ = x->data[2];
00208                 *out4++ = x->data[3];
00209                 *out5++ = x->data[4];
00210                 *out6++ = x->data[5];
00211                 *out7++ = x->data[6];
00212                 *out8++ = x->data[7];
00213                 *out9++ = (float)bitmask;                                       // Contains the 16-bits of digital inputs
00214                 
00215                 x->last_value = value;                                          // store the input value for the next time around
00216         }
00217 out:            
00218         return (w+13);
00219 }
00220 
00221 
00222 // DSP Method
00223 void teabox_dsp(t_teabox *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00224 {
00225     dsp_add(teabox_perform, 12, x, 
00226         sp[0]->s_vec, 
00227         sp[1]->s_vec, sp[2]->s_vec, sp[3]->s_vec, sp[4]->s_vec, sp[5]->s_vec, sp[6]->s_vec, sp[7]->s_vec, sp[8]->s_vec, sp[9]->s_vec, 
00228         sp[0]->s_n);
00229     teabox_getstatus(x);                                                        // automatically report the status when the dsp is turned on    
00230 }
